summary:
Tamasine McNabb is a visual creative from Denmark, based in Haarlem, the Netherlands. Interior Designer and also founder of ŌERUM Design, she is an aesthete at heart, a dreamer and an all round creative. After 8 years working as an Interior Designer gaining experience at various design studios in both Amsterdam and Dubai, she decided to make her hobby and love for creating art her work.

Being completely in awe of the world around us, Tamasine is forever inspired by raw materials, craftsmanship and the pure beauty of nature. Tamasine also loves to create a warm and cosy atmosphere in which she believes that art plays a big role; bringing a space together and making it complete. Art is a story, a personal experience and something that you can continually look at and get completely lost in which is exactly what BOKETO stands for. Like her name Tamasine, BOKETO is also Japanese meaning “the art of daydreaming and getting lost in thought”.

She is fascinated by Japanese culture – in particular ‘wabi sabi’; finding the beauty in imperfection. She is very inspired by the Japandi style and loves to work with natural materials, warm, earthy colours and the technique of mixed media to create her artwork.

Originating from Denmark and further raised in Tanzania, the Netherlands, Singapore, United Kingdom and Dubai for the past six years, she is an International individual with an open mind, not afraid to take on new projects & challenges.

education.degree_name: BTEC Foundation Diploma Art and Design

profile_positions.description:
Sustainable Fine Jewellery for everyday wear founded through a passion for #puresimplequality. 
Made from solid recycled 18k Gold and lab-grown diamonds.
Re-thinking the industry from the ground up with a giving back promise.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
(formerly known as CircadianID)

"The passage of time has marked many changes in the way we live, work and play, even in the way we see spatial design. The need of the hour is to create transformative areas that are synchronised with individual desires and preferences; to create ‘destinations’ rather than spaces, and this is exactly what Circadian does, every day.

A sister company to Insignia Worldwide, who have been pioneers in creating enriching brand experiences for the luxury, travel and hospitality sector, Circadian is a natural progression of the brand story. We design bespoke spatial environments and interior concepts for commercial establishments, dining venues as well as office environments."

Roles & Responsibilities:
Leading and managing a team of architects, designers, draughtsmen and visualisers to oversee and guide the work. Project management and planning. Preparing cost proposals, schedules and design presentations for clients. Concept development through imagery mood boards and sketches, preparing the schematic design and definitive detailed drawing packages, material sourcing, digital 3D modelling and image manipulation.

Projects and Clients:
Maqan Hospitality
The Kanoo Group
Rue 71
Homegrown Eco Nursery
Globe Group
Danat Al Raha Beach Hotel

Press Releases:
http://www.hoteliermiddleeast.com/24598-interior-design-firm-for-hospitality-launched/
http://www.khaleejtimes.com/business/local/circadian-introducing-fresh-interior-design-perspectives
profile_positions.title: Senior Interior Designer & Head of Department

company.name: DsignlinQ LLC   Dutch Design and Trusted Consultancy

profile_positions.company: DsignlinQ LLC   Dutch Design and Trusted Consultancy
profile_positions.description:
"4 Award Winning Dutch Design studios, each specialists in their own field decided to join forces in the Middle East region. DsignlinQ provides a full range of interior design and consultancy services with emphasis on quality design, strong technical knowledge and attention to detail. Our team of international professionals composed of architects, interior designers, consultants and graphic artists has the experience and capacity to manage complex world wide projects of all scales."

My responsibilities include:
- interior design, conceptual design and development
- translation of concept design through sketches and (image)presentations
- space planning
- finish selection and specification
- furniture design and specification
- concept 3D pre-visualisation
- computer aided technical drawings
- contact with clients, suppliers and contractors
- involvement in design and advice meetings
- plans and estimates
- house style design

Projects and Clients:
Ambiance improvement study & facility design standards, Dubai International Airport, UAE
Scarabee SEC Offices, Hoofddorp, NL
Amsterdam Schiphol Airport
Meraas
profile_positions.title: Interior Designer

profile_positions.description: TAMASINE was established in order to accept work on a freelance basis with Amsterdam Design Studios including UXUS, Tjep., Bsquared and DsignlinQ until being outstationed in Dubai full-time for DsignlinQ.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
"Tjep. is an Amsterdam based team of misfit-fitting designers and non-designers challenging themselves to question the world and make unexpected connections. In every project our goal is to combine outstanding design with artistic thinking and a profound commitment to enhancing the quality of the physical world around us."

As the lead Interior Designer I was involved and responsible for all stages of a project from concept development to schematic and definitive design as well as the execution phases. The type of projects I was involved in and around the Netherlands include the hospitality sector, theatre, airport food & beverage outlets, airport master planning as well as the workplace and key public spaces.

My responsibilities (project dependent) include:
- concept design
- translation and development of concept design through sketches and (image)presentations
- presentation of colour and material proposals
- 3D visualisations
- technical drawings
- contact with clients, suppliers and contractors
- involvement in design consultation meetings
- intern mentor and supervisor

Projects & Clients:
Philips LAC Fashion & Food, Eindhoven, NL
Zaantheater, Zaandam, NL
European Central Bank, Frankfurt, D
Frames Art Cafe, Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, NL
profile_positions.title: Freelance Interior Designer

profile_positions.description:
"Studio Linse develops interior concepts, ranging from commercial and public spaces to exclusive boardrooms and private yachts."

As Junior Interior Designer I was involved in all stages of a project from concept development to schematic and definitive design as well as the execution phases. The type of projects I was involved in and around the Netherlands include retail spaces, workplace environments for key public spaces, graphic development for commercial areas, various hospitality projects including a signature sustainable hotel design as well as food & beverage outlets in prominent airports in Asia and the Netherlands. 

My responsibilities (project dependent) include:
- concept design
- translation and development of concept design through sketches and (image)presentations
- presentation of colour and material proposals
- 3D visualisations
- technical drawings
- contact with clients, suppliers and contractors
- involvement in design consultation meetings
- intern mentor and supervisor

Projects & Clients:
Farm by Belvedair, Eindhoven, NL
Farm To Go by Belvedair, Eindhoven, NL
Amstlvn by Unibail-Rodamco, Amstelveen Stadshart, NL
Amstelkwartier Hotel, Amsterdam, NL
Security Filters & Gates at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol
Seats2Meet, Den Haag, NL
profile_positions.title: Junior Interior Designer

profile_positions.description:
At UXUS I worked on a project basis, responsible for the development of the interior concept for a signature market-cafe experience, converting concepts into innovative design solutions, interior styling, space planning in AutoCAD, presentation preparation as well as 3D modelling in SketchUp to later be converted into visualisations for Concept Presentation.

Projects & Clients:
Selland's, California, USA
profile_positions.title: Freelance Interior Designer

profile_positions.description:
At Anna Hart Design I was responsible for creating image mood-boards, assembling material-boards as well as compiling detailed specification sheets in a presentation format for various hospitality and commercial projects. I was also responsible for contacting suppliers and drawing up plans in AutoCAD to render and visualise afterwards.

Projects & Clients: 
Greenbank Hotel, Cornwall, United Kingdom
North Somerset Council, Cornwall, United Kingdom
